data.title: Fresno State Athletics
data.meta_description: March 6, 2000 FRESNO, Calif. - No. 19/20/23 ( Baseball Weekly/Collegiate Baseball/Baseball America ) Fresno State will host the 22nd Annual Pepsi/Johnny Quik...
data.text:
March 6, 2000

FRESNO, Calif. - No. 19/20/23 (Baseball Weekly/Collegiate Baseball/Baseball America) Fresno State will host the 22nd Annual Pepsi/Johnny Quik Classic this week at Pete Beiden Field. The eight-team tournament will be played from March 6-11 and will feature Bowling Green, Creighton, Gonzaga, Indiana State, Southern Illinois, Temple and UNC-Asheville. Two of this year's participants previously have won classic titles -- Creighton in 1991 and Indiana State in 1998. Three teams will be making their PJQ debuts this year -- Southern Illinois, Temple and UNC-Asheville. Four games will be played each day beginning at 10 a.m. Fresno State has won 10 classic championships in its 21 appearances and has a 90-32-1 record all-time in the tournament. A complete list of this year's Pepsi/Johnny Quik Classic schedule is below.

22nd Annual Pepsi/Johnny Quik Classic Schedule

Monday, March 6

10 a.m. Bowling Green vs. Creighton

1 p.m. UNC-Asheville vs. Southern Illinois

4 p.m. Gonzaga vs. Indiana State

7 p.m. Temple vs. Fresno State

Tuesday, March 7

10 a.m. Indiana State vs. UNC-Asheville

1 p.m. Southern Illinois vs. Gonzaga

4 p.m. Bowling Green vs. Temple

7 p.m. Creighton vs. Fresno State

Wednesday, March 8

10 a.m. UNC-Asheville vs. Gonzaga

1 p.m. Indiana State vs. Southern Illinois

4 p.m. Temple vs. Creighton

7 p.m. Fresno State vs. Bowling Green

Thursday, March 9*

TBA Red No. 1 vs. Blue No. 4

TBA Red No. 2 vs. Blue No. 3

TBA Blue No. 1 vs. Red No. 4

TBA Blue No. 2 vs. Red No. 3

Friday, March 10*

TBA Red No. 1 vs. Blue No. 2

TBA Red No. 3 vs. Blue No. 4

TBA Blue No. 1 vs. Red No. 2

TBA Blue No. 3 vs. Red No. 4

Saturday, March 11**

10 a.m. Seventh-place game

1 p.m. Fifth-place game

4 p.m. Third-place game

7 p.m. Championship game

*-Games on Thursday and Friday will not necessarily be played in the order listed. Game times and matchups for Thursday will be announced following the completion of Wednesday's action. Game times and matchups for Friday will be announced following completion of action on Thursday. (Note -- Fresno State will play in the 7:00 p.m. game on Thursday and Friday regardless of its seeding).

**-The order of Saturday's games are subject to change -- if Fresno State does not play in the championship game, it will play in the 4 p.m. game regardless.
